biogHist.abstract: St Lukes Anglicare Records is a collection including the records of children and young people cared for by St Luke's Anglicare in out-of-home care from 1979.
biogHist.p: Past clients of St Luke's out of home services can access their records by applying in writing to the CEO, St Luke's Anglicare. Please mention your name, any other names you may have been using while in care and your date of birth. Identifying information about your parents or brothers and sisters who were also in care is helpful in searching our archives. If you can tell St Luke's the approximate time you were with them and the service you received that would also be helpful.

The collection at St Lukes Anglicare includes the records of children and young people cared for by St Luke's in out of home care from 1979. The client files vary in size: some are small, and contain only a few sheets of paper in a folder. Others are much larger and contain disks with digital photos, art work and booklets such as maternal and child health care records.
Records of St Luke's Toddlers' Home up until 1978 are held by Anglicare Victoria.
Records for children who lived in the Good Shepherd family group homes prior to St Luke's taking them over should be with Good Shepherd.

resourceRelation.relationEntry: 'St Luke's Anglicare Records', in Find & Connect - Victoria,
